content: The "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" defines terms like "Federal land" and "Henderson Redevelopment Agency" in relation to the project site. It also references the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 for definitions of hazardous substances, pollutants, and remedies. The "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" defines terms like "Henderson Redevelopment Agency," "map," "Responsible Party," and "Secretary" in relation to the project site. The "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" defines terms like "Responsible Party" as the private sector entity designated by the Henderson Redevelopment Agency for the Three Kids Mine Project Site, "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, "State" as the State of Nevada, and "Three Kids Mine Project Site" as the 1,262 acres of land including Federal and adjacent non-Federal land depicted on the map. Land conveyance is addressed in the Act. The "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" defines the Three Kids Mine Project Site as including Federal and adjacent non-Federal land, depicted on the map. The Act addresses land conveyance, where the Secretary will convey all right, title, and interest of the United States in the Federal land to the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, subject to certain conditions being met. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency will acquire the Federal land by paying its fair market value determined through an appraisal conducted according to national standards. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency will acquire Federal land at fair market value determined by appraisal standards. The estimate for assessing, remediating, and reclaiming the Three Kids Mine Project Site will be prepared by the Secretary. The Phase II environmental site assessment for the Three Kids Mine Project Site must be based on a comprehensive report approved by the State and prepared according to ASTM International Standard E-2137-06. The Phase II environmental site assessment must adhere to ASTM International Standards E-1527-05 and E-1903-11. The Secretary will review cost information provided by the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, the Responsible Party, and the State for estimating costs. If there is a disagreement, they will jointly select experts to assist in making the final cost estimate. The Secretary will begin the appraisal and cost estimates within 30 days of the Act's enactment. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency or Responsible Party will reimburse appraisal costs. The fair market value of Federal land will be adjusted based on estimated remediation and reclamation costs. The conveyance under subsection (a) is contingent on the Secretary receiving a written agreement from the State. The conveyance under subsection (a) is contingent on the Secretary receiving a written agreement from the State regarding a mine remediation and reclamation agreement. The mine remediation and reclamation agreement required under subparagraph (A) shall be an enforceable consent order or agreement between the State and the Responsible Party to perform necessary work at the Three Kids Mine Project Site to protect human health and the environment from hazardous substances. The mine remediation and reclamation agreement at the Three Kids Mine Project Site will ensure all necessary actions to protect human health and the environment from hazardous substances, in compliance with Federal, State, and local regulations. It will also include provisions required by the State and the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, including financial assurance for completing the remedy. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency must notify the Secretary within 90 days of the mine remediation agreement to accept conveyance of Federal land. The Federal land is withdrawn from various activities for a 10-year period after the conveyance. The Federal land is withdrawn from entry, appropriation, operation, disposal under public land laws, location, entry, patent under mining laws, and disposition under mineral leasing laws. Any withdrawal under public land laws that includes Federal land no longer needed by the Bureau of Reclamation is relinquished to allow for immediate conveyance as required by the Act. The applicable law is relinquished to exclude unnecessary property and allow immediate conveyance of Federal land. Existing rights holders can continue using water conveyance infrastructure on Federal land. Additionally, the ACEC boundary can be adjusted. The River Mountains Area of Critical Environmental Concern boundary is adjusted to exclude the Three Kids Mine Project Site. After conveyance, mine remediation and reclamation responsibilities apply to the Responsible Party and the State of Nevada. After conveyance, mine remediation and reclamation responsibilities apply to the Responsible Party and the State of Nevada. If terms of the agreement are not met, the Secretary retains the responsibility for additional response actions to protect public health and the environment. This Act does not affect compliance with environmental laws. SEC. 7. SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LANDS MANAGEMENT ACT does not apply to land conveyed under this Act.
